question: Can I refinance my mortgage if my home value increased to $350,000 and my credit score is 720?
true_answer: Yes, refinancing is possible with credit score 720 and sufficient home equity.

steps.content: Can I refinance my mortgage if my home value increased to $350,000 and my credit score is 720?
Plan: 1) Retrieve refinance eligibility criteria. 2) Verify credit score adequacy. 3) Calculate loan-to-value (LTV) ratio. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Provide final answer.
Retrieving knowledge on mortgage refinance eligibility.
Refinancing generally requires a credit score of at least 620 and a favorable LTV ratio.
Credit score check: 720 is excellent and qualifies for refinancing.
What does LTV ratio mean, and how does it affect refinancing?
LTV ratio is the mortgage amount divided by appraised property value, influencing loan terms.
Calculating LTV ratio with an assumed current mortgage balance.
LTV ratio calculated as 75%, which is favorable for refinancing.
Review complete, all eligibility criteria met.
Are there any fees involved in refinancing?
Refinancing may involve closing costs, often ranging from 2-5% of the loan amount.
Yes, refinancing is possible with your credit score and home equity. Consider closing costs, typically 2-5% of the loan.
